artist: Artist: Taguchi Beisaku; Publisher: Mizuno Asajirō
creditline: Gift from the collection of Edith and the late John Payne
description: vertical ōban triptych; triptych forming a single image; two figures on horseback on right side of image; gray stone wall behind figures; left figure gazes toward PR, toward a hazy horizon in blue pigment, with faint view of a house, trees and mountains on left; maroon sun behind mountains on left; pink and yellow gradated sky; inscriptions in Japanese characters in top center margin and along left margin
inscription: on left sheet, in top margin, in pencil: language unknown | on left sheet, on back, in URC, in pencil: 23 | on left sheet, in URC, in pencil: 2RH | on left sheet, on back, in LRC: BEiSAKU 650- \" | on right sheet, on back, in ULC, in blue pigment: 23
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
title: Picture of Bizarre-Looking Manchurian Cavalrymen Departing to the Front in Distant View of the Japanese Camp near Caohekou
